value.title: Waymo expanding self-driving car operations to Downtown Phoenix
value.excerpt: On March 30, officials with Waymo announce they are expanding their self-driving car operations in Phoenix, years after they began self-driving car operations in a part of the East Valley. FOX 10's Linda Williams reports.

value.title: China's Baidu exploring options after U.S. delisting risk
value.excerpt: Chinese search engine giant Baidu Inc said on Thursday it is exploring options, after the company was added to a U.S. securities regulator’s list of companies that face the risk of being delisted.

value.title: Waymo's self-driving cars are coming to downtown Phoenix
value.excerpt: The autonomous car company has already been operating its self-driving vehicles around the East Valley for years.

value.title: Waymo Expands Self-Driving Car Trials to San Francisco
value.excerpt: Way-mo, way-mo, off to work they go. Waymo employees in San Francisco will be able to catch a ride to work from its fleet of self-driving, all-electric Jaguar I-PACE cars.

value.title: Waymo begins fully driverless robotaxi rides in SF
value.excerpt: Waymo has started giving fully driverless robotaxi rides to its employees in San Francisco. The company also announced its plan to open up its robotaxi service in downtown Phoenix. This morning, an all-electric Jaguar I-PACE picked up a Waymo engineer on their way to work.

value.title: Tesla’s head of AI is on sabbatical and people are worried
value.excerpt: Elon Musk announced that Tesla’s head of AI, Andrej Karpathy, is on a four-month sabbatical, and people are worried since other Tesla execs have left after going on sabbatical. It comes as Tesla expands its Full Self-Driving (FSD) Beta to Canada.

value.title: Baidu to launch self-driving taxi service in Zhejiang
value.excerpt: Chinese tech giant Baidu Inc said it will offer self-driving taxi service in Wuzhen, Zhejiang province, on Saturday, as part of the company's broader drive to accelerate the large-scale commercialization of autonomous driving technology.
